intro: Drypetes natalensis var. leiogyna, commonly known as the Natal drypetes, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are an important food source for birds and mammals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests and secondary growth areas.
